Dear Barre families,

I am reaching out to you as we get closer to the start of school. You may have heard that the Vermont Agency of Education and Department of Health revised their guidance to schools on August 11th. This new guidance reinforces the need to safely return students to school, especially for children ages 10 and under and changes some of the distancing recommendations. The BUUSD Reopening School Team, composed of teachers, paraprofessionals, principals, a representative from our school nurses, and other administrators reviewed this guidance. We decided to stay with our plan to reopen schools with a Hybrid Model and a Virtual Learning Model. This is necessary during this initial phase of reopening to ensure that our safety procedures and staffing ratios are effective. I recognize that we need to return to full in-person operations as soon as possible. We will be monitoring our situation over the start of school and stand ready to adjust our plans as conditions hopefully improve.

Sincerely,

David Wells
Superintendent

Barre City registered voters are needed to fill one open school board seat on the Barre Unified Union School District Board. The successful candidates may reside in any Barre City ward. post_text: Amy Butler, from North Branch nature Center, joins my second graders for our weekly ECO sessions. This morning she helped our class tag two of our newly emerged Monarch Butterflies. The tag number will be entered into a database. If our butterflies are spotted (in warmer places like California or Mexico, where Monarchs migrate to), we will be notified of their location. This is the first time a school in Central Vermont has participated in Monarch Butterfly tagging. What a wonderful opportunity and experience for Barre City School!
